intro: Tetrapterys discolor var. typica, commonly known as the variable waxyleaf tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive waxy, pale green leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
